title: How to Draw a Spider Web

steps.title: Take your pencil and on the top of the page, about two inches from the right start drawing a line to 2 inches (5.1 cm) below the right top corner.
steps.content: Take your pencil and on the top of the page, about two inches from the right start drawing a line to 2 inches (5.1 cm) below the right top corner. The line should loop down and have points. [1] X Research source (see the picture)

steps.title: Draw straight lines from the points in your first line to the corner.
steps.content: Draw straight lines from the points in your first line to the corner. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Make lines parallel to your fist line going all the way up.
steps.content: Make lines parallel to your fist line going all the way up. You should have 5 or 6 lines.

steps.title: Get a paper and make a cross on it, try to make both lines a similar length (using a ruler will help)
steps.content: Get a paper and make a cross on it, try to make both lines a similar length (using a ruler will help)

steps.title: Draw diagonal lines through the centre, dividing the paper up from 4 to 8 sections.
steps.content: Draw diagonal lines through the centre, dividing the paper up from 4 to 8 sections. Make sure they are smaller than the cross you made before. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Start connecting the lines with inverted arcs, this is an arc ), from the inside out.
steps.content: Start connecting the lines with inverted arcs, this is an arc ), from the inside out.

steps.title: Once you have reached the end of the web, elongate the diagonal lines, (this will make it look like it has supports).
steps.content: Once you have reached the end of the web, elongate the diagonal lines, (this will make it look like it has supports).

steps.title: Draw a spider by making a fuzzy ball, then drawing legs (eight of them) on your web.
steps.content: Draw a spider by making a fuzzy ball, then drawing legs (eight of them) on your web. Or see the spider drawing tip. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Draw a circle and draw a cross section which also extends outside the circle.
steps.content: Draw a circle and draw a cross section which also extends outside the circle.

steps.title: Draw two diagonal lines at the midpoint of the cross-sections which form an X-mark.
steps.content: Draw two diagonal lines at the midpoint of the cross-sections which form an X-mark.

steps.title: Draw squares which descend in size as it nears the centre point.
steps.content: Draw squares which descend in size as it nears the centre point. Draw the corners or vertices of the square along the diagonal lines.

steps.title: Draw diamond shapes descending in size as it nears the centre point.
steps.content: Draw diamond shapes descending in size as it nears the centre point. Draw the vertices along the lines of the cross-section.

steps.title: Draw curves to connect the lines – from the squares to the diamonds, much like forming bridges.
steps.content: Draw curves to connect the lines – from the squares to the diamonds, much like forming bridges.

steps.title: Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines.
steps.content: Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary lines. You may add drawings for spiders.
